item.title: Tasmanian farmed salmon industry granted emergency federal approval to use florfenicol antibiotic
item.description: The industry's use of the drug is in response to an "endemic" bacterial disease that caused the deaths of up to 15,000 tonnes of salmon from January to April, resulting in dead fish material washing up on multiple beaches.

item.title: Ramping in SA at six-month low as Health Minister apologises to patient stuck outside FMC
item.description: SA's Health Minister has apologised to a patient who was ramped outside hospital for several hours as the government releases its ambulance ramping data for October, which is at a six-month low.

item.title: Readers on the grief that comes with euthanasing a dog
item.description: This is what you had to say about the heartbreak that comes with the death of a pet.

item.title: Fire danger information missing from new Bureau of Meteorology website
item.description: As bushfire season approaches, firefighters say the BOM's redesigned website is missing crucial safety data — a gap some fire chiefs fear could put lives at risk.

item.title: Craig Robert Dale jailed for $2.77 million fraud of Aboriginal community of Warmun
item.description: Craig Robert Dale is jailed for seven years for defrauding the remote Aboriginal community of Warmun out of $2.7 million, to fuel his gambling.

item.title: WA Premier says upgrade to Perth Convention Centre not value for money, after plans scrapped
item.description: The WA premier insists a cancelled upgrade of the Perth Convention and Exhibition Centre would not have been value for money, despite the deputy premier previously describing the building as a "cockroach".

item.description: The former Australian captain believes it is time for the talented opener to go back to basics as he finds himself on the outer as the Ashes begin.

item.description: The same Chinese company that makes electric buses now under review in Denmark and Norway also has electric buses on Australian roads.

item.description: Andrew Wilkie has asked the PM to allow a free vote on banning gambling advertising and it appears many Labor MPs would support it.

item.description: European leaders now feel a very existential threat from Russia but it seems their own problems at home are constraining them from doing anything about it.

item.description: Storms are expected across a large part of inland Queensland, with the Darling Downs region set to cop another weekend of severe weather.

item.description: Here is how the Formula 1 drivers' championship standings are poised heading into the final three rounds of the season.

item.title: Eastern ground parrot found in Narawntapu National Park, Tasmania
item.description: The presence of an endangered and "cryptic" parrot species at a northern Tasmanian national park is hailed as "very good news" by a bird expert.

item.title: RBA warns economy in danger of being trapped in slow growth lane indefinitely
item.description: The central bank's deputy governor says it's "more plausible" to wonder whether rates can go much further than to forecast further cuts. He says unless Australia's economic capacity lifts, the economy will struggle to grow without generating inflation.

item.title: French 'Fedora man' pictured at Louvre heist scene unmasked as teenager
item.description: A 15-year-old is unmasked as the "Fedora man" in a viral image taken outside the Louvre on the day of the crown jewels heist.

item.title: This street is home to two cities with opposite laws and politics
item.description: These two US cities share a name and a main street, but come election time, following the rules on one side of the road could land you in jail on the other.

item.title: US Senate votes in favour of bill to end federal government shutdown
item.description: The US Senate votes in favour of ending the longest government shutdown in the country's history, which has lasted for 40 days.

item.title: Emergency department waits of 35 hours for some SA mental health patients, AMA warns
item.description: About 10 per cent of mental health patients in South Australian hospital emergency departments are being kept waiting "more than 35 hours" for a bed, the AMA says.

item.title: Donald Trump booed at NFL game between Washington Commanders and Detroit Lions
item.description: Donald Trump is booed by sections of the crowd as he becomes the first sitting US president to attend a regular-season NFL game in nearly half a century.

item.title: The trams that made Melbourne: Celebrating 140 years since the city's first cable tram
item.description: Melbourne's history with trams goes back 140 years. The city got its first tram in 1885 and the fleet has grown to become the world's largest tram network.

item.title: Mark Parton elected as Canberra Liberals leader as Leanne Castley steps down, Jeremy Hanson resigns as deputy
item.description: There has been a complete shake-up in the leadership of the Canberra Liberals, with Mark Parton elected the new leader after Leanne Castley stepped down earlier this morning.

item.title: Boy, 8, dies after being found unresponsive in pool near Shepparton
item.description: A child has died after being found unresponsive in a pool in northern Victoria.

item.title: Richmond set to host 'home' AFL fixture in Tasmania for the first time in club's history
item.description: Richmond will run out for a home game in Tasmania for the first time in its history next season in a decision the club says it has not taken lightly.

item.title: The AFL's Wildcard Round has been met with negative reviews, so why does it exist?
item.description: Footy fans are not impressed with the AFL's new finals-extending Wildcard Round, but it is all part of Andrew Dillon's grand plan for total domination of Australian sport.

item.title: Youngest town in WA's Kimberley faces life without a cemetery
item.description: From a floating coffin to a bed of rock, time is running out for Kununurra's cemetery.

item.title: Bradley Wayne Wilkinson jailed for 16 years over road rage manslaughter of Rhyce Harding
item.description: A driver has been handed a 16-year jail sentence after he "used his vehicle as a weapon" to cause the tragic death of Rhyce Harding in Sydney's west.

item.title: NSW to review inmate classifications following prison guard bashing
item.description: The Commissioner of Corrective Services will undertake a review of inmate classifications after the assault of four prison guards earlier this year.

item.title: On the Myanmar-Thailand border, bombing a scam centre could barely dent the industry
item.description: Myanmar junta bombing of a scam centre is little more than "political theatre" to appease the international community, an expert says.

item.title: South Korea's former president accused of provoking military conflict with North Korea
item.description: Yoon Suk Yeol attempted to provoke military conflict between South and North Korea in order to declare martial law, a prosecutor's spokesperson tells a briefing.

item.title: Lions are 'unrelenting' and yet again the underdogs for this finals series
item.description: The Brisbane Lions secured a spot in their sixth consecutive preliminary with a win over Melbourne on the weekend. Yet with North Melbourne's dominance, the Queenslanders are "underdogs" in the race for the flag once again.

item.title: Family and police appeal for information linked to Brandon Yates's fatal stabbing
item.description: Police launch a public appeal to help find the killer of 28-year-old man who died from stab wounds in Wollongong's main street.

item.title: Mark Parton elected as new Canberra Liberals leader
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Redress scheme opens for 3,000 Stolen Generations survivors in WA
item.description: Survivors of the Stolen Generations in Western Australia can now apply for $85,000 in compensation as part of a government redress scheme.

item.title: Cameron Green to test reworked bowling action in Sheffield Shield clash ahead of Ashes
item.description: Australia is hopeful that a slight adjustment to Cameron Green's bowling action allows the star all-rounder to have a big say in this summer's Ashes campaign and beyond.

item.title: If your child wants an e-bike or e-scooter, this is what you need to know
item.description: E-bikes and e-scooters might sound like an exciting gift for a teenager or child, but experts say there are several things to consider before buying one.

item.title: A leaked memo brought down two senior BBC bosses — here's what it said
item.description: A leaked memo to the BBC's editorial standards board has dominated headlines in Britain and led to the resignations of two board members. Here's a look at what has happened and how the bosses responded.

item.title: Who is Jay Weatherill, Australia's new high commissioner to the UK?
item.description: Australia's next high commissioner to the United Kingdom's time in politics was defined by consultative leadership, pizza politics and a gatecrashed press conference.

item.title: Measles warning issued for South West and Great Southern as confirmed case numbers climb
item.description: Authorities and experts urge people in the state's south to be on alert for measles as the number of community transmission cases continues to climb.

item.title: Cudlee Creek bushfire class action trial begins in SA's Supreme Court
item.description: Victims of the devastating 2019 Cudlee Creek bushfire, which caused more than $200 million in damage, are seeking compensation from SA Power Networks, alleging the electricity distributor was negligent in the lead-up to the blaze.

item.title: Family of murdered backpacker Simone Strobel still seeking answers 20 years after death
item.description: The family of German backpacker Simone Strobel says a second inquest into her death has failed to bring them answers about how and why she died on holiday in NSW 20 years ago.

item.title: Nampijinpa Price pulls out of Put Australia First rally appearance with far-right activist Tommy Robinson
item.description: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price was due to speak at the Put Australia First event later this month alongside Tommy Robinson, a one-time member of a fascist political party.

item.title: Monday finance with Daniel Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Mitchell Starc fires Ashes warning in Sheffield Shield return as Jake Weatherald and Beau Webster fail to fire
item.description: Mitchell Starc enjoys a successful return to red ball cricket while representing New South Wales but Jake Weatherald and Beau Webster fail to grab their opportunities.

item.title: Push for a ban on using ‘doulas’ during childbirth
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: CCTV footage of a youth wielding a machete at the Yeperenye Shopping Centre in Alice Springs.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Donald Trump pardons Rudy Giuliani and others involved in trying to overturn 2020 election
item.description: The US president has pardoned his former lawyer Rudy Giulian and others who were involved in trying to overturn the 2020 election.

item.title: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy from prison pending appeal
item.description: Sarkozy became the first former French president to be sent to prison in modern times, this September.

item.title: Eight dead and many injured after car explosion near Delhi's historic Red Fort
item.description: Police say the explosion came from a car stopped at a red light outside the city's 17th Century Red Fort area.

item.title: Trump threatens to sue 'corrupt' BBC for $1.5b over 'salacious' documentary
item.description: Lawyers for the US president warn Britain's national broadcaster they are preparing to sue it over "fabricated" statements that aired in its Panorama program last year.

item.title: Infrastructure Victoria calls for upgrade to 'unreliable and infrequent' Upfield train line in Melbourne's north
item.description: In one booming growth area, north of Melbourne, locals are forced to drive to avoid long delays for trains during peak periods. Multiple groups are calling on the state government to upgrade its services.

item.title: Early childhood professors release six-point plan to fix 'broken' childcare system
item.description: Some of Australia's leading early childhood education professors join forces to release a six-point action plan to help fix the country's "broken" childcare system.

item.title: A damning memo shows the BBC's issues are bigger than its coverage of Donald Trump
item.description: It is not US President Donald Trump who represents the biggest political threat to the BBC, but a leaked 8,000-word letter of complaint to the broadcaster's board motivated by "despair at inaction".

item.title: The faces with a front-row seat to history
item.description: After Gough Whitlam was sacked, a crowd formed. They could have stormed the building. Fifty years on, this photo tells the story of The Dismissal.

item.title: Why Australia's iron clad future is under threat
item.description: For decades, China has resented being held hostage over the iron ore price by its own insatiable demand and a handful of Australian producers.

item.title: CCTV footage of Moree assault
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Crime rates are down in Moree, but police admit they cannot 'arrest their way out' of youth crime problem
item.description: Youth crime rates have fallen in the rural NSW town of Moree but tensions within the community remain high after a string of violent incidents.

item.title: COP30 kicks off 10 years on from the Paris Agreement. Where is the world at?
item.description: It was a moment of euphoria when the world came together to sign a pact on climate action. Ten years on from the 2015 Paris Agreement, we managed to shift the needle. But the problem is, it is just not happening fast enough.

item.title: DV prevention advocate Kym Valentine urges action on delayed alcohol laws
item.description: Advocates are concerned changes to alcohol delivery laws, which were a recommendation of South Australia's Royal Commission into Family, Sexual and Domestic Violence, are taking too long.

item.title: US risks AI debt bubble as China faces its 'arithmetic problem', leading analysts warn
item.description: Two leading experts on the world's biggest economies warn both countries face serious challenges, and not just over trade with each other.

item.title: Millennials and Gen Z voters continued shift away from Coalition in 2025
item.description: As Liberals prepare to fly to Canberra to hash out their net zero stance, results from the Australian Election Study suggest those under 45 have continued to drift away from the Coalition.

item.title: Cardiac patient reveals urgent surgery at Sydney public hospital was cancelled four times
item.description: Ian Parker waited more than three months for urgent heart surgery that should have been done within 30 days. He was inspired to share his story after an ABC investigation.

item.title: Hidden Garden Estate cancels weddings after announcing insolvency
item.description: Southern Tasmanian wedding venue Hidden Garden Estate announces its immediate closure, leaving couples scrambling ahead of their wedding day.

item.title: Amazon Flex drivers on battling bots and the culture of fear to keep their jobs
item.description: Tech giant Amazon claims to offer convenience to both its customers and its contractors. This is what the drivers behind your packages want you to know.

item.title: Drug driving overtakes drink driving in fatal Qld road accidents
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Drug driving now more deadly than drink driving in Queensland as police ramp up testing efforts
item.description: More than 1,000 positive drug tests involving cocaine have been recorded by Queensland police since the narcotic became part of the state's roadside testing regime as drug driving overtakes drink driving in fatal crashes.

item.title: ACT government withholds payment to contractor over missed MyWay+ deadline
item.description: The ACT government is withholding a payment from technology company NEC, which was tasked with rolling out the botched MyWay+ public transport system.

item.title: Bat colony causes Gympie council to consider property buyback scheme
item.description: A Queensland council will consider seeking government funding for a property buyback scheme as part of a new flying fox management plan.

item.title: Who is the man that wants to 'leave shit behind' as the new ACT opposition leader?
item.description: To be the leader of the Canberra Liberals you need to be thick-skinned, have a lot of persistence, and be very confident — and if Mark Parton's first press conference in the role is anything to go by, he might just be the perfect fit.

item.title: Ferrari boss tells drivers to 'talk less' after Lewis Hamilton's 'nightmare' comment
item.description: Lewis Hamilton says his first season with Ferrari has been "a nightmare" after the team suffers another failure, this time at the Brazilian Grand Prix.

item.title: Federal politics live: Anthony Albanese says Whitlam dismissal was 'calculated plot'
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says the dismissal of Gough Whitlam's government in 1975 was a "partisan political ambush". Follow live.

item.title: Micro parties on the rise as discontent with major parties grows in regional NSW
item.description: As voters demand better political representation in the bush, two new micro parties in the NSW Riverina region promise to be a solution.

item.title: Stunning icicle kick by David Rodríguez wins Canadian Premier League final
item.description: A blizzard, a sensational overhead kick goal, snowploughs clearing the pitch for extra-time, the Canadian Premier League soccer final had it all.

item.title: Owners barred from Beachport holiday units after council fire safety change
item.description: Meg Longstaff hoped to continue a family tradition of beach holidays this summer, but a council decision on fire safety enforcement means she and other unit owners may be forced to make other plans.

item.title: Live updates: Australian share market set to rise after tech rebound on Wall Street led by Nvidia
item.description: A tech rebound on Wall Street is likely to send Australian stocks higher as Nvidia and Palantir lead a jump in AI stocks. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

item.title: Dandenong Mayor pays tribute to woman and boy who drowned in Melbourne's southeast
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Council pauses to pay tribute to Dandenong Creek drowning victims
item.description: A Melbourne council has paused for a minute's silence in honour of a woman and a child who drowned in Dandenong Creek on Monday afternoon.
